data.enText: the unhappy feelings caused by knowing or thinking that you have done sth wrong
She had feelings of guilt about leaving her children and going to work.
data.chText: 她因离开自己的孩子去工作而感到内疚。

data.enText: Many survivors were left with a sense of guilt .
data.chText: 许多幸存者都有内疚感。

data.enText: a guilt complex (= an exaggerated sense of guilt )
the fact that sb has done sth illegal
His guilt was proved beyond all doubt by the prosecution.
data.chText: 他的罪行已被原告方证实确凿无疑。

data.enText: blame or responsibility for doing sth wrong or for sth bad that has happened
The investigation will try to find out where the guilt for the disaster really lies.
data.chText: 此调查将尽力查出灾难的真正责任所在。

data.enText: things you say to sb in order to make them feel guilty about sth
Don't lay a guilt trip on your child about schoolwork.
data.chText: 别让你孩子对学业自责不迭。

ex.enText: She made a terrible blunder when introducing the girl to her husband.
ex.chText: 她把那个女孩介绍给她丈夫是犯了一个极大的错误。

synonyms.bx: 指由于愚蠢或疏忽大意等造成的错误。

ex.enText: I made a boob throwing that document away.
ex.chText: 我犯了个愚蠢的错误，把那份文件扔掉了。

synonyms.bx: 指因愚蠢的行为犯下的过错。

ex.enText: I tried to make a great meal but only made a botch of it.
ex.chText: 我试图做顿大餐，可是搞砸了。

synonyms.bx: 主要指干得拙劣、一塌糊涂的活儿。

ex.enText: He realized that mentioning her ex-husband was a bit of clanger.
ex.chText: 他意识到提及她的前夫有点儿冒失，令人尴尬。

synonyms.bx: 指愚蠢的或令人难堪的过错。

ex.enText: The government has committed a serious error/mistake.
ex.chText: 政府犯下了严重的错误。

ex.enText: There are too many errors/mistakes in your spelling.

synonyms.bx: 可指任何错误，包括笔误、印刷错误或计算错误，常可与 mistake 换用。

ex.enText: There was once a popular fallacy that the world is flat.
ex.chText: 人们曾经普遍误以为地球是平的。

synonyms.bx: 尤指很多人持有的错误观点或想法。

ex.enText: He is still an excellent politician despite the faults he's committed.
ex.chText: 尽管他犯过一些错误，他仍是一名出色的政治家。

ex.enText: The minister is quite satisfied with his secretary because he can find no fault with her work.
ex.chText: 部长对他的秘书很满意，因为她的工作无可挑剔。

synonyms.bx: 表示“缺点，毛病”时为可数名词；表示“过失，过错”时为不可数名词。

ex.enText: The boy behaved badly, but in fact the guilt lay with his parents.
ex.chText: 这个男孩表现很不好，但实际上责任在于其父母。

synonyms.bx: 指对发生的坏事负有的责任。

ex.enText: I have made a mistake in grammar.
One silly mistake cost us the match.
ex.chText: 一个愚蠢的错误使我们输掉了那场比赛。

synonyms.bx: 指行为、看法、言辞等方面的错误。

data.enText: things you say to sb in order to make them feel guilty about sth
Don't lay a guilt trip on your child about schoolwork.
data.chText: 别让你孩子对学业自责不迭。

tr: remorse caused by feeling responsible for some offense
the state of having committed an offense

example.ex: Her emotions had ranged from anger to guilt in the space of a few seconds...
example.tran: 几秒钟的时间里，她经历了从愤怒到内疚的情感变化。

example.ex: Some cancer patients experience strong feelings of guilt.
example.tran: 一些癌症病人懊悔不已。

value.def: Guilt is an unhappy feeling that you have because you have done something wrong or think that you have done something wrong.

example.ex: The trial is concerned only with the determination of guilt according to criminal law...
example.tran: 依照刑法规定，审判仅涉及定罪。

example.ex: You weren't convinced of Mr Matthews' guilt.
example.tran: 你不相信马修斯先生有罪。

value.def: Guilt is the fact that you have done something wrong or illegal.
